title: Ticket #4439: $$ macros don't work in transfer_input_files
description:
Using $$ macros in transfer_input_files (e.g. transfer_input_files = x_$$(OpSys).zip) fails, because condor_submit tries to open the input file to check that it exists at submit time (obviously before the macro substitution happens).

It looks like you can work around this by having a file literally named "x_$$(OpSys).zip" (or whatever) that exists at submit time, but I don't think you should have to do that.
remarks:
2014-Jul-10 15:22:14 by wenger:
This also applies somewhat to log files, output files, etc. -- condor_submit creates them without resolving the macro, and then they get re-created with the "real" filename.
